title: Ekko is now above 57% winrate.
body:
57.47% winrate today 2016-04-10
Highest winrate champion in the game (when played top).

Counters the most champs in the game.

63.45% winrate pre 25m.

32% banrate only trumphed by Malphite, Zed and Master Yi, and rising. (But sadly not fast enough)

Playerbase avarage games = 25 (has a VERY inexperienced playerbase)

Very experienced Ekko players avarage at almost 60% winrate.

Beginner/inexperienced Ekko players avarage at about 54% winrate.
(High skillfloor where are you?)

What's to be said about this? All data more or less indicates that this champion is incredibly scewered at the moment. 
But honestly, who cares about data, anyone who's been on the recieving end of this monster knows how incredibly frustrating he is to deal with, and that the ammount of resources needed to keep him in check is well beyond staggering and simply, NOT. FAIR.

So the quesiton is: 

When will this be adressed?

Wait a minute, people think Ekko has a high skill cap? The only aspect of his kit that is even remotely difficult to use is his stun, but not because of the Ekko player. The skill is incredibly easy to avoid. Take a look at the average Ekko progame, you'll notice that he usually doesn't land his stun. Like... ever. It's almost always walked out of or at best forces a flash.
To me, that says something about the champion design. If you can have a skill that is rarely effective, yet still be an S tier pick, something is fucked up.
Ekko does have a pretty high skill cap tbh, his entire kit relies on predicting, and setting stuff up.
If we go with that logic, then Zilean and Teemo are also high skill cap champions.

It's sorta... true though. You can't just throw mushrooms in lane. You scout their jungle with wards, see what routes they take, where they gank, when their buffs are back up. You use mushrooms in places they have to step on. The radius is actually pretty small and easy to walk around without knowing its there. Whenever a Bard is playing I put mushrooms on his chimes, before his chimes, after his chimes, etc. Mushrooms in bushes where they back. Make their jungle yours and go invisible in it, wait till they hit a mushroom, blind at the right time, etc. 

He has a low skillfloor though. If you know how to right click you can do well with him. But, his skillcap is high too. Requires a lot of knowledge of the game.
Yeah, landing a W stun is something I'm still trying to land in lane, without hiding in a bush.

Skill cap and skill floor are vastly different. An example of this is Zed : Zed is easy to pick up(skill floor), and do alright with. But to be an amazing zed and crush teams almost alone (Skill ceiling, like a lee sin) you gotta get really good with him.
Welcome to Season 6. Play the OP Tier 1 champs or lose (especially if you're solo)

> [{quoted}](name=SlaktarTasken,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ueflc3Gr,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-04-10T00:17:51.801+0000)
> When will this be adressed?

Next patch. Reduced base damage on his passive w and e. Frozen fist is being nerfed. Grasp of the Undying is being nerfed. Those are four nerfs to tank ekko right there.

The problem with Ekko isn't him by himself, per say. When played as an Assassin/Mage he has to stand back and wait for opportunities to do burst damage without being constantly on your ADCs. Its his hyper mobile, sticky kit with tank items and the grasp of the undying + sunfire + iceborne gauntlet combo. If they just nerfed Ekko it would just open itself up to the next sticky character that can use those items (hello Akali?).

TL;DR: Tank Ekko is getting two direct nerfs and two nerfs to the items that allow him to do relevant damage. He's being addressed.

to stop tank ekko all they have to do is removed heal from ultimate and maybe lower the base on his shield
that's all

****REMOVE THE HEAL ON ULT****

YOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
I'd rather remove the damage on it. The entire point of the ult is that he goes back in time to a place where before he was damaged lol. Healing him and putting him in a previous location.

if you remove the damage, you will further move ekko on the path of build tanky for utility and more efficient heal.
look, if you want someone to be played as a damage dealer, that someone must be able to deal dmg

i mean, he was originally meant to play as a bruiser, not an assassin, the way to go is to probably lower his damages all over and let him be the tank, but hit his base as well so he doesn't have the insane damage for building tanky.
if i recall correctly, they always wanted ekko to be an assassin. One that needs to play smart to succeed, not spam QWER to win

issue with that is that he has a kit that isn't balanced for being an assassin. with shields, cc, dashes and heals, his kit as an assassin will need to be nearly incapable of working, which will always push him towards building tank or bruiser.

if he's balanced towards being a bruiser or a tank, he actually has a chance of working without much kit shifting, its just a matter of lowering his damage output.

Ekko ult heal is the only thing that allows him to play tanky.
Every single champion in this game that can play tank has a way to improve:
their hp, their armor, their magic resis or take less damage thx to their skill mechanic (for example braum shield, alistar ultimate or maokai ultimate).

Ekko has none of that except his ultimate heal. With it removed, he becomes a "budget" and "weak" tank.

His w provides a health shield (pretty pathetic without HP, but still). Amumu barely has any mechanics to resist damage (his e reduces auto attacks still, right?). But you're pretty on the ball when it comes to tanks, the only 'tank' that doesn't have any sort of those mechanics is Zac, who instead regains missing HP.

Note, though, that you don't need these mechanics to play tanky. For example like I said, right after Tankko there's Tankali (not as good, but still a thing).

Tank Ekko is a big problem. Riot has nerfs for his base damages, Grasp mastery, and IBG as well on the PBE at the moment.

Other Ekko playstyles beside Tank Ekko are fine.
Ekko is incredibly stupid right now but he's damn fun to play as. He's pick, ban or dodge for me right now.
Ekko is a champion that should have never been released, just like Illaoi, Tahm, Kalista, so many toxic mechanics just for the sake of being new.
